properties.Title: Civil Emergency, Alert From Sk Provincial Emergency Communications Centre
properties.Summary:
Description: All travelers returning from outside of Canada are subject to a mandatory 14 day self isolation order. Violation of the order may result in a fine of 2000 dollars. Information on COVID 19 can be found at Saskatchewan.ca COVID 19

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong westerly winds will reach up to 90 kilometres per hour beginning tonight. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: ROAD DUST ADVISORY IN EFFECT FOR BURNS LAKE, SMITHERS, QUESNEL AND VERNON The Ministry of Environment and Climate Change Strategy in collaboration with Northern Health has continued a Road Dust Advisory for Burns Lake and Smithers because of high concentrations of coarse particulate matter that are expected to persist until there is precipitation or dust suppression. Levels tend to be highest around busy roads and industrial operations. This advisory is in effect until further notice. Persons with chronic underlying medical conditions should postpone strenuous exercise near busy roads until the advisory is lifted. Exposure is particularly a concern for pregnant women, infants, the elderly and those who have diabetes, and lung or heart disease. Real-time air quality observations and information regarding the health effects of air pollution can be found at https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air ### For more information on current air quality, visit www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2020-03-21T14:33:48-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment, 2020-03-20T22:34:48-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1808452716.2020
Area: North Okanagan, Cariboo - north including Quesnel, Bulkley Valley, Lakes District
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment

properties.Title: Blowing Snow Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Poor visibility in snow and blowing snow is expected or occurring in some locations. Falling snow and blowing snow will reduce visibilities to 800 metres or less near the Richardson Mountains tonight. Visibilities will improve early Saturday morning as the snow and wind abate. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility in some locations. Blowing snow advisories are issued when winds are expected to create blowing snow giving poor visibility to 800 metres or less for at least 3 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather in British Columbia or Yukon, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm or #YTStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-21T14:53:41-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-20T22:54:41-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0633770854.2020
Area: Dempster
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with gusty winds and visibility frequently near zero in snow and blowing snow are expected or occurring. Total snowfall amounts: 20 to 40 cm. Peak wind gusts: northwesterly 110 km/h. Locations: Postville-Makkovik to Natuashish. Time span: tonight through Saturday. Remarks: Snow at times heavy will persist through tonight and Saturday. Strong northwesterly winds will develop overnight tonight in the Natuashish area and will spread south to Postville-Makkovik by Saturday afternoon. These winds will combine with the fresh snowfall to reduce visibility at times to near zero in blowing snow. Conditions are expected to improve Saturday night as the snow tapers off and the winds begin to ease. ### Travel is expected to be extremely hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 4 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-03-21T17:48:11-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-21T01:49:11-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1909766954.2020
Area: Postville - Makkovik, Hopedale and vicinity, Nain and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Maximum gusts: westerly 100 km/h, except 120 km/h in the Canada Bay area. Locations: Great Northern Peninsula. Time span: Saturday afternoon and evening. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. Total snowfall amounts: 20 to 30 cm. Peak wind gusts: northwesterly 100 km/h. Locations: Black Tickle to Rigolet. Time span: tonight through Saturday evening. Remarks: Snow at times heavy will persist through tonight and Saturday. Strong northwesterly winds will develop Saturday afternoon and will combine with the fresh snowfall to reduce visibility in blowing snow. Conditions are expected to improve Saturday night as the snow tapers off and the winds begin to ease. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Winter storm warnings are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-03-21T17:48:33-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-21T01:49:33-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3499322684.2020
Area: Cartwright to Black Tickle, Rigolet and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, heavy at times continues. The frozen ground has a reduced ability to absorb this rainfall. Locations: southern and western Newfoundland. Total rainfall: 30 to 60 mm in the south and 15 to 25 mm in the west. Time span: tonight. Strong southerly winds and mild temperatures will accompany the rainfall to cause significant snowmelt and runoff, leading to potential flooding. ### Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-03-21T13:59:08-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-21T01:49:08-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2172939913.2020

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rainfall, combined with melting snow, is expected. The frozen ground has a reduced ability to absorb this rainfall. Over 25 millimetres of rain is expected for higher elevations today. The rain, combined with the snowmelt, could accelerate runoff and increase the water levels of some rivers. ### Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 15 to 25 cm is expected. Locations: Norman Bay to L'Anse-au-Clair, as well as Eagle River and Upper Lake Melville. Time span: continuing until Saturday morning. Remarks: Snow at times heavy will change to rain by early Saturday morning from Norman Bay to L'Anse-au-Clair, but will persist until Saturday evening over Upper Lake Melville and Eagle River. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-03-21T17:47:36-00:00
